thread.title: Vatican beefs up IOC contacts, but cautious on Rome bid
thread.title_full: Vatican beefs up IOC contacts, but cautious on Rome bid

title: Vatican beefs up IOC contacts, but cautious on Rome bid
text:
Vatican beefs up IOC contacts, but cautious on Rome bid Vatican beefs up IOC contacts, but cautious on Rome bid Oct 1, 2015 Comments 
VATICAN CITY (AP) â€” The Vatican is beefing up its contacts with the International Olympic Committee but isn't taking sides in Rome's bid for the 2024 Games, which organizers hope will include the marathon winding through St. Peter's Square. 
The head of the Pontifical Council for Culture, Cardinal Gianfranco Ravasi, is due to travel to IOC headquarters in January, the highest-ranking Vatican official to do so. 
The aim is to improve contacts and look toward creating a permanent Vatican-IOC liaison office, said Monsignor Melchor Sanchez de Toca y Alameda, the council's undersecretary. 
But he said the Vatican was loath to get involved in the bidding process, saying it couldn't take sides among cities competing to host the games. He also questioned the feasibility of running the marathon through St. Peter's. 
Rome is competing against Paris, Los Angeles, Hamburg and Budapest. More Headlines
